title: Collateral Schema
description: Data schema to define collateral (currently can reference loans or accounts).

id.description: The unique identifier for the collateral within the financial institution.

loan_ids.description: The unique identifiers for the loans within the financial institution.

account_ids.description: The unique identifier/s for the account/s within the financial institution.

charge.description: Lender charge on collateral, 1 indicates first charge, 2 second and so on. 0 indicates a combination of charge levels.

encumbrance_amount.description: The amount of the collateral that is encumbered by potential future commitments or legal liabilities. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

encumbrance_type.description: The type of the encumbrance causing the encumbrance_amount.

end_date.description: The end date for recognition of the collateral

source.description: The source where this data originated.

sources.description: Identifiers for data sources. Useful for analytics and MI purposes.

start_date.description: The start date for recognition of the collateral

type.description: The collateral type defines the form of the collateral provided

value.description: The valuation as used by the bank for the collateral on the value_date. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

value_date.description: The timestamp that the collateral was valued. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

version_id.description: The version identifier of the data such as the firm's internal batch identifier.

vol_adj.description: The volatility adjustment appropriate to the collateral.

vol_adj_fx.description: The volatility adjustment appropriate to currency mismatch.
